jaxfluids.materials.material module

class jaxfluids.materials.material.Material(unit_handler: jaxfluids.unit_handler.UnitHandler, dynamic_viscosity: Union[float, str, function], sutherland_parameters: List, bulk_viscosity: float, thermal_conductivity: Union[float, str, function], prandtl_number: float, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: abc.ABC

The Material class implements an abstract class for a material, i.e., the computation of the dynamic viscosity, bulk viscosity and the thermal conductivity. The equation of states are implemented in the corresonding child classes.

eps = 2.220446049250313e-16
abstract get_energy(p: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, rho: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Computes specific internal energy e = e(p, rho)

Parameters

  • p (jax.Array) – Pressure buffer

  • rho (jax.Array) – Density buffer

Returns

Specific internal energy buffer

Return type

jax.Array

abstract get_grueneisen(rho: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Computes the Grueneisen coefficient from density. Gamma = p_e / rho; p_e is partial derivative of pressure wrt internal specific energy.

Parameters

rho (jax.Array) – Density buffer

Returns

Grueneisen

Return type

jax.Array

Computes psi from pressure and density. psi = p_rho; p_rho is partial derivative of pressure wrt density.

abstract get_total_energy(p: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, rho: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, u: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, v: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, w: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Computes total energy per unit volume from pressure, density, and velocities. E = E(p, rho, velX, velY, velZ)

Parameters

  • p (jax.Array) – Pressure buffer

  • rho (jax.Array) – Density buffer

  • u (jax.Array) – Velocity in x direction

  • v (jax.Array) – Velocity in y direction

  • w (jax.Array) – Velocity in z direction

Returns

Total energy per unit volume

Return type

jax.Array

abstract get_total_enthalpy(p: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, rho: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, u: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, v: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase, w: jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase) → jaxlib.xla_extension.DeviceArrayBase[source]

Computes total specific enthalpy from pressure, density, and velocities. H = H(p, rho, velX, velY, velZ)

Parameters

  • p (jax.Array) – Pressure buffer

  • rho (jax.Array) – Density buffer

  • u (jax.Array) – Velocity in x direction

  • v (jax.Array) – Velocity in y direction

  • w (jax.Array) – Velocity in z direction

Returns

Total specific enthalpy buffer

Return type

jax.Array

jaxfluids.materials.material_manager module

class jaxfluids.materials.material_manager.MaterialManager(unit_handler: jaxfluids.unit_handler.UnitHandler, material_properties: Dict, levelset_type: str)[source]

Bases: object

The MaterialManager class is a wrapper class that holds the materials. The main purpose of this class is to enable the computation of material parameters for two-phase flows, i.e., the presence of two (different) materials.

eps = 2.220446049250313e-16

jaxfluids.materials.safe_ideal_gas module

class jaxfluids.materials.safe_ideal_gas.SafeIdealGas(unit_handler: jaxfluids.unit_handler.UnitHandler, dynamic_viscosity: Union[float, str, function], sutherland_parameters: List, bulk_viscosity: float, thermal_conductivity: Union[float, str, function], prandtl_number: float, specific_heat_ratio: float, specific_gas_constant: float, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: jaxfluids.materials.material.Material

Implements the safe ideal gas law, i.e., prevents division by zero and negative square roots
